# Symbia Integrations Service

> Centralized gateway for third-party API traffic. Sole bridge to the external world in most Symbia networks.

## Overview

Centralized gateway for third-party API traffic including LLM providers.

- Execute LLM operations (chat completions, text generation, embeddings)
- Supports OpenAI and HuggingFace providers
- Normalized response format across all providers
- Credential management via Identity service
- Provider configuration via Catalog service
- Execution logging and usage tracking

## API Base URL

Use http://localhost:5007 as the base path for all endpoints.

## Quick Reference

- POST /api/api/integrations/execute - Execute an LLM operation
- POST /api/api/integrations/invoke - Invoke any registered integration operation
- GET /api/api/integrations/providers - List available providers
- GET /api/api/integrations/providers/{provider} - Get provider configuration
- GET /api/api/integrations/providers/{provider}/models - Get available models for a provider
- GET /api/api/integrations/capabilities - Get comprehensive provider capabilities
- GET /api/api/integrations/registry - List all registered integrations
- POST /api/api/integrations/register - Register a new integration
- GET /api/api/integrations/registry/{key}/operations - Get operations for an integration
- POST /api/api/integrations/mcp - MCP JSON-RPC endpoint
- GET /api/api/integrations/mcp/info - Get MCP server info
- POST /api/api/integrations/mcp/register - Register an external MCP server
- GET /api/api/integrations/usage - Get usage summary for organization
- GET /api/api/integrations/status - Get service status
- GET /api/api/integrations/circuit-breaker - Get circuit breaker status
- POST /api/api/integrations/circuit-breaker/reset - Reset all circuit breakers
- POST /api/api/integrations/circuit-breaker/reset/{provider} - Reset circuit breaker for a provider
- POST /api/api/integrations/db/export - Export in-memory database to file
- GET /api/api/integrations/db/status - Get database status

## Authentication

Methods supported:
- Bearer token (Authorization: Bearer <token>)
- API key (X-API-Key header)
- Session cookie

- Bearer token authentication (Authorization: Bearer <token>)
- Cookie-based session authentication (token cookie)

## Custom Headers

- Authorization: Bearer token for authentication
- X-Org-Id: Organization ID for credential scoping

## Documentation

- OpenAPI: /docs/openapi.json
- Full docs: /docs/llms-full.txt
